column1: “In the instant appeal, I would hold that the default of ci(cid:415)ng a person not living as
the respondent in the no(cid:415)ce of appeal and the pe(cid:415)(cid:415)on of appeal which resulted from
the  negligence  of  the  defendants-appellants  and  the  registered  A(cid:425)orney-at-Law
would render the no(cid:415)ce of appeal and the pe(cid:415)(cid:415)on of appeal void ab ini(cid:415)o and liable
to be rejected in limine. This defect being incurable the defendants-appellants cannot
seek any relief in terms of sec(cid:415)on 759(2) of the Civil Procedure Code to amend the
cap(cid:415)on to bring in the person who should have been made respondent to the no(cid:415)ce
of appeal and the pe(cid:415)(cid:415)on of appeal.” [page 336]
